body.p:
Mt Sterling Ky
Nov the 2nd; 1864
Mr Thomas: Bramlet

Sir I as A friend and one wishing to obtain some information concerning my condition as A Recruit of 1st, Ky Calv take the liberty to drop you A few lines asking your advice what to do I was Enlisted on the 7th of May 1862 under Lt. D. R. Carr and he told me positively that he was Recruiting for the unexpired time of the Regment and by him promiseing me that I should be Discharged when the Regment was I Enlisted in Co. C of the 1st Ky calv and I want to know, how I am to Manage to get A discharge when the Regment Does as I am unwilling to Serve in another Regment
without the liberty of valenteering my own Service So I will look for an Answer to this as soon as you can send it to me here at Mt Sterling: believe Me cir yours &c

James J. Roberson
Co: C 1st Ky. Calv

Mt Sterling Ky
Nov 2" 1864 --
Roberson Jas J--
Compy-- (C) 1" Ky Cav
To
The Gov --
States that he enlisted on the 7" of May 1862 for unexpired time of the regiment-- He is unwilling to serve out three years in another regiment -- How can he get a discharge --

L B No 7 -- 1864 P, 491
Recd A. G. O. Nov 4" 1864--
